ovdesc.p: Letter of Credit controls the administration and processing of both Letters of Credit and Documentary Collections. It is fully integrated within T24.
It automates accounting, limit exposure, position updating, control and administration of trading activity and ensures efficient delivery of the related advices, documents, and payments.

The Letter of Credit types processed by the system can be customised using the LC.TYPES application, where combinations of the major features of an LC can be set up. (e.g. import/export, sight/usance (term), confirmed/unconfirmed, etc.)

It is important to note that the details set up on the Letter of Credit application do not make any payments or reimbursements. In order to achieve this, a Drawing must be entered via the DRAWINGS application. This will be linked to the LETTER.OF.CREDIT contract.
A history of each LETTER.OF.CREDIT contract. and in particular the charges processed for the contract, is held on the LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES application.

Many events occur within the life of a LETTER.OF.CREDIT contract. Each event is recorded on the contract by (I)nputting to the contract and usually the OPERATION field on the contract will control the event being entered.
The main transactions that the system can process are:
ISSUANCE OF A LETTER OF CREDIT

Used when the Bank opens a Letter of Credit on behalf of its client (applicant) which will be advised to the beneficiary, via the Bank's correspondent. Usually in the country that the beneficiary resides.
ADVISING/CONFIRMING A LETTER OF CREDIT

Used when the Bank receives a Letter of Credit that has been issued by another Bank and is requested to forward it. (Sometimes via a third party Bank) to the beneficiary with or without adding confirmation.
PRE-ADVISE A LETTER OF CREDIT

At the request of the applicant, a pre-advice is sent by the issuing Bank, prior to their issuance of the operative credit instrument, to provide the beneficiary, via the advising bank, with brief details of the LC which is in the process of being opened.
AMENDMENT OF A LETTER OF CREDIT

This facility will allow the user to insert any changes which will produce an amendment to the original terms and conditions of an LC and automatically generate all relevant accounting entries for commissions, increase or decrease of the principal amounts, and advices and documents to the Electronic delivery system.
OPEN A REMITTANCE DOCUMENTARY COLLECTION (EXPORT)

Used when the Bank (acting as Remitting Bank) receives a Documentary Collection from its client (the drawer) in respect of goods/services they have sold to their customer (the drawee). The bank forwards the documents to their Correspondent (The Collecting Bank) in the country of residency of the drawer for presentation to the drawee against payment/acceptance.
OPEN A COLLECTING DOCUMENTARY COLLECTION (IMPORT)
Used when the Bank (acting as Collecting Bank) receives a Documentary Collection from another Bank (The Remitting Bank) for presentation to the Bank's client (the drawee) against payment/acceptance.
MAIN FEATURES OF THE APPLICATION --------------------------------
The main features of the module can be described as follows:
1. INPUT PROCESSING

Validation is performed to ensure the correctness of any transaction input. All inputs will update limits, positions, accounts, etc.. in real time. After authorization of the transaction, all the documents, advices, and SWIFT messages applicable for the L/C will be automatically generated by the Electronic Delivery System.
All L/C types can be entered in local or foreign currencies, i.e. contracts can be denominated in any currency.
2. CHARGE PROCESSING

Default charges for all types of Letters of Credit and Documentatary Collections can be entered via the LC.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION application, and will be automatically calculated by the system. The facility to add extra charges or amend charges is available, together with the facility to waive all charges. All charge entries are automatically generated, and if specified in a foreign currency, positions will be updated accordingly. Charges can be amortised over the life of the contract, frequencies defined by the user.

Charges can be claimed from a number of parties involved in the Letter of Credit or Documentary Collection. It is important to note that charges can be denominated in a currency other than the Letter of Credit /Documentary Collection Currency.
Once an LC is authorised, all charges are recorded in the LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES file. Should further charges be input the file will automatically be updated.
3. DOCUMENT PROCESSING

All documents required to be produced by the input of the transaction will be generated by the Delivery application in order to facilitate easy amendment and customisation of the forms. The T24 Graphical User Interface provides a simple way of entering large volumes of text.
Frequently used text and clauses can be entered via the LC.ADVICE.TEXT and LC.CLAUSES applications, and then linked into the transaction by entering a short code into the fields provided.
4. ENQUIRIES AND REPORTS

In common with other T24 Applications, all data can be enquired upon or selectively analyzed and researched. The system will also automatically produce reports of Collections Due, Unpaid Charges, etc.

This field is used to identify the type of Revolving Letter of Credit applicable.
Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative.
T24 fully support the internationally recognized understanding of cumulative and non-cumulative revolving letters of credit.

A revolving letter of credit is issued for $10,000 revolving on the 15th day of every month with 3 revolutions. An initial drawing of $6000 is made and no further drawings were made by the 15th of the month (i.e. the time the first revolution is set to take place).

For a Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the unutilized amount of $4000 will be carried over by the system to the next revolution period. i.e. the system will provide for the first revolution to be drawn for an increased amount of $14,000 (being $10,000 + $4000)
For a Non-Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the untilled portion of $4000 is now unavailable for drawing and the system will provide for the fist revolution to be drawn for $10000 only..
Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative.
Default will be null, which indicates that the letter of credit is not revolving.

Code to identify the required status of the charge. Used to identify if the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived.User defined field.
The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are as follows:
blank - The charge has not been taken yet
2 - The charge has to be taken immediately to the debit of the charge account given above

3 - The charge has been claimed. If status 3 is input then the charge will be debited to CRF (claimed bucket) and profit and loss will be credited. At this stage tax if any associated with the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE or the FT.CHARGE.TYPE will not be debited to the CRF bucket.
4 - A claimed charge has been settled. This will be allowed to be input only in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES.
5 - A claimed charge has been written off to the debit of profit or loss. Input allowed only in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES file.
15 - The charge has been waived.
Notes:
(i) A claim advice is sent to the charge party when charge status is input as 3.

(ii) When the charge is paid the operator will manually access the LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES file, where all the charge details are presented after authorization of the L/C, update the file from 3 to 4 to indicate that the payment has been received, and the CRF Claimed bucket reimbursed.

(iii) When claimed charge is not paid, the operator will manually access the LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES file and change the charge status from 3 to 5. This will reverse the profit and loss and credit to CRF bucket.

desc.p: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. The following codes are valid:

Operation 'C' provides the operator with the ability to either record a new charge or amend (not cancel or write-off) a previously input charge. Operation 'C' also displays all uncollected charges (having null status) in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES, which are available to the operator to amend. However, keeping the status unchanged at null will enable the system to rewrite the charges back in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES.

When using 'T' trace, an MT420 will be produced and the next process date will have to be modified.

Operation D is used when a decision on a Pending Amendment is to be taken as either Approved or Rejected. Use of this option opens up AMEND.NO and AMEND.STATUS. to use this the Letter of Credit has to be previously authorised in its O status.

p.p: For a new contract the following are valid: O - open, P - pre-advise
For an existing contract the following are valid: A - amend, C - direct charge, T - trace (collections only), D decision.

In a partially Confirmed Letter of Credit this field can be input with a value that represents the portion of the Letter of Credit that has been confirmed.
